result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Kirkland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. Kirkland

records.addlTxt: Status Conference held on December 14, 2015 with Judge Boles presiding. Filed by Court Reporter T Carlson
Hearing on October 27, 2015 with Judge Boles presiding. Filed by Court Reporter T Carlson

11:27 This also includes 15CM168   Defendant Michael J. Kirkland in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Michael J. Kirkland in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich addresses the PSI Chapman   Pg 2 description of offense 3rd parag   toss the child to the floor it was actually on the couch.   Pg 3 victim stmts. 1st paragraph-  Cuts on face were cuts on the head.       Froelich Pg 3  area is disputed. Changed by the Judge and initialed.  Victim rights have been complied with. Victim wishes to make statement. Froelich gives his arguement.   220 days credit.    Ct 1  1.5 yrs confinement 2 yrs ext supervision.  Ct 2 - 1.5 yrs confinement 2 yrs. Ext Supervision consecutive to each other.  Ct 3 9 mo in jail concurrent to Ct 1 & 2. Restitution $590.93   Ms. Baumann addresses the court.  Chapman - Impose and stay a prison sentence. 4 yrs probation   compliance with all mental health counseling ordered and comply with chips order  6 months conditional jail time  Defendant addresses the court. Court finds:  Ct 1  3 yrs confinement     3 yrs extended supervision    Ct 2   1.5  yrs confinement   2 yr extended uperviceion       ct 1 & 2   Consecutive to each other  Ct 3 9 months PC Jail concurrent to Ct 1 & 2    220 days credit for time served         The Court would like  Mental health condition be asses and properly dignosed and treatement provided.  Assessmt for AODA and any treatment recomended be done while in confinement.   Conditions of extended supervision.    No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.  Comply with all condtions set by the agent and comply with the mental health evaluations, and treatment.  No contact with Rachel Baumann while on extended supervistion unless  approved by the probation agent.  DNA sample and surcharge. Comply with any programing required by DOC.  Restitution $590.93   Supervision fees  When released obtain and maintain full time employement.
15CM168   Froelich - 6 months jail concurrent to sentence in 15CF190  217.00 Restitution  Chapman agrees to the sentence. Defendant gives a statement.  Court orders 6 months jail concurrent to sentence in 15CF190
Sentencing hearing at 04-05-2016 11:00 am.

9:39 Defendant Michael J. Kirkland in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Michael J. Kirkland in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM168 heard at this time. Froelich: guilty to charge in 15CM168. Files amended information with 3 counts; Def will plead guilty to all three. Requests PSI. time to determine restitution. Chapman and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Court reads charges and possible penalties contained in the amended information.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to charge in 15CM168 and Ct#1,2,3 contained in the amended information in 15CF190; Chapman stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of charge in 15CM168 and Ct#1,2,3 contained in the amended information. Court orders a PSI on 15CF190 and asks the agent to look at the facts in 15CM168 for a recommendations.

Atty Chapman requests telephone contact between Def and the victim. Atty Froelich wasn't prepared to address this time and would like time to discuss with victim. Court: would like the position of the victim before making a ruling.

Plea hearing at 01-26-2016 09:45 am.
Sentencing hearing at 04-05-2016 11:00 am.
Status conference at 01-26-2016 09:45 am.

3:38 Defendant Michael J. Kirkland in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.15CM168 heard at this time. Chapman: Def is requesting their own evaluation and waives his right to a speedy trial. Def waives his right to a speedy trial. Court: set for another hearing.
filed by Dr Minter

3:37  Defendant Michael J. Kirkland in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Michael J. Kirkland in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Chapman requests that the defendant have permission to have contact with the children. Court will allow contact through letters with the 2 minor biological children that are his and they will first be reviewed and approved  by the DHS before going on to the children.  Letters are to be sent to Janelle Wolf at the PCDHS  PO Box 670 Ellsworth, WI 54011.  If a letter is deemed to be harmful to the children by DHS they should be sent back to Dan Chapman.
Hearing at 12-14-2015 03:00 pm.
for Examination under 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)

Chapman states they wish to withdraw NG pleas and enter NGI pleas.  Speedy trial demanded.  Court states he will appoint expert for examination and sign order.

3:38 Defendant Michael J. Kirkland in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appears via phone.  Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and maximum penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty to charge. Court rec's and enters. Froelich: $2000 signature bond with no contact. Nelson has no objection. Def has not been in the armed services.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
